title: Procurement overview
line1: Follow the process below to create your procurement. Each stage can be saved and resumed at any time.
line2: You can download and save what you enter to your own system.
line4: View the terms and conditions for this lot in the
agreement_description1: Follow the process below to create your procurement. Each stage can be saved and resumed at any time.
agreement_description2: You can download and save what you enter to your own system.
agreement_description3: View the terms and conditions for this lot in the lot detail page.

sections: Use the supplier filtering tool first to create and download a shortlist of suppliers and rate cards that provide the management consultancy services you need. Using this service means you're following the public sector procurement procedures.

The supplier list generated by this tool will be applied to all pre-market engagement and call-off activities in this project. You will have to change the requirements if you want to contact all suppliers that are available in this lot.
subsections: Every supplier is checked to make sure they can supply the products or services offered by the commercial agreement.
You can only access suppliers’ rate cards through the filtering tool.

sections: You can ask suppliers questions, before formally publishing your requirements, to find out what products and services are available, or refine your needs.
For the lot you selected, you can do pre-market engagement in one of the following ways:
subsections: Find out if suppliers are interested in bidding for your project and can offer the products or services needed. If a supplier does not respond to an EoI sent from the buyer, they cannot bid for the opportunity later.
Ask suppliers about the products and services they offer and the commercial terms needed to buy them.
This section is optional, if you’re ready to write and publish your requirements you can go straight to the next step.
You cannot run stages 2 and 3 at the same time.

sections: Write and publish your bid pack. Suppliers can then respond to your requirements and complete any other evaluation tasks set by you.
You will need a clear set of criteria that suppliers must meet, and be evaluated against. You will also need to include how you will score their responses.
For the lot you selected, you can run your procurement in one of the following ways:
subsections: You will need to invite all suppliers to bid for your opportunity and assess all bids that are submitted.
This is also known as one-stage further competition
Based on the supplier responses you receive, if you find a single supplier who can meet your needs you can choose to award your contract directly to them after completing a capability assessement.
You need to complete this step before you can award your contract.
If you start this step you cannot start step 2 at the same time.

sections: You must evaluate suppliers to find the one that best meets your requirements.
You should use the methods and criteria you published with your requirements to assess and score suppliers.
You can then award a contract to your preferred supplier.
When you have completed your evaluation and found a suitable supplier, you can award your contract.
You will need to give feedback to any unsuccessful suppliers.
You need to publish the contract on Contracts Finder. This is a legal requirement.

content.text: Digital Specialists and Programmes, Lot 2: Specialists
